reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel to be ideally located attached to Victoria Station with the Tube and many major bus lines right outside the door. The bus ride to major attractions using an Oyster card never took more than 15-20 minutes. Took the Tube to Heathrow for a whopping sume of 5 pounds. The room we stayed in had been recently added for the Olympics. It was larger than many European hotel rooms with all amenities working well. But, the best part was the conceriege service, especially a gentleman named Paul. He was extremely helpful in teaching us the navigational ropes of the buses and pointing us to good pubs and interesting sites. Thanks Paul. We are planning on going back to London next year and will very likely stay at the Grosvensor again. The only negative is a 1 computer "business center" which is not only difficult to find in the hotel but only accomodates 1 guest at a time. Fortunately, we were too busy running around London to care.
reviews.title: Ideally located and not overpriced

reviews.text: I would stay here again....and again. We spent a week here and it was just amazing. The "twin" beds were oversized by American standards and hubby and I fit into one. I can't imagine what the housekeepers thought! They laid out a sumptuous breakfast every morning and the tea/coffee and cookies were something we looked forward to every afternoon as we came back from touring. It's worth any extra amount of money.
reviews.title: Warm, fuzzy stay - fantastic location

reviews.text: This is a very very large hotel and easy to get lost in, with it being spread over 2 buildings, but once you get your bearings poses no problems.
reviews.title: Should be 5 star!

reviews.text: This is a better than average London Hotel is a great location just next to Victoria Station. I booked directly by internet, and got a very reasonable rate. Although my booking was non-chageable and non-refundable, the hotel were very helpful in allowing me to change dates without any penalty. The foyer is classical and impressive, and this classical style continues throughout the hotel. Check in was quick and efficient, and I got a room even though I arrived before the regular check in time of 15:00. The single rooms are pretty small, but par for the course in London. In spite of being small, they are clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. The hotel staff were all very friendly and wanted to please.
reviews.title: Better than average London Hotel in a great location

reviews.text: I booked a single room here for one night including breakfast. I specified a quiet room on a high floor. The single rooms are advertised as spacious and quiet. My room (511), admittedly bigger than the one photographed on their website (bedside table either side of the bed, and a little lobby affair on entering) didn’t particularly have a spacious feel to it although it was by no means the smallest single I’ve stayed in. It was well appointed, with tea/coffee making facility, complimentary bottled water, a decent hairdryer, fab walk in shower (instant hot water) with glass door - no nasty shower curtain, and a heated towel rail that worked. The bed was a small double and very comfy with 2 great pillows. However, traffic noise was very intrusive despite the secondary glazing (My trusty earplugs to the rescue.) – and it was not on the main road either, so where are all these quiet rooms located? Be aware that the fifth floor rooms are in the eaves and so have tiny windows making the room quite dark. I was only staying one night so neither the noise nor the lack of light was vital but for a longer stay it would have bothered me.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.text: Breakfast was busy – but a good selection of food. Toast delivery was a bit erratic; mine turned up almost instantaneously, along with the chap’s on the next table, but he had already finished his food.

reviews.text: Although not cheap, for a single person the rate compared very favourably with the budget brands in the same area (e.g. Travelodge/Premier inn) and of course was a much more upmarket experience! – and the location is excellent. Travelling on my own, I would probably stay here again, although I would still choose another hotel over this one if it provided free wifi – other hotels can, why not the Grosvenor? However, if returning with my partner, there would be a number of contenders in this price range and district for a smart double with breakfast…
reviews.title: Service is second to none

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on Friday late afternoon and could perform the check in immediate. The deskemployee ( Ashleigh ) was very pollite and told us everything we needed to know about the hotel, more then once mentioning that if we had any qouestions, we could ask at any time. The room itself was beautiful, enormous high windows, wonderful bathroom ( wich was very clean ), couch, desk and a closet with as a detail, lighting when opening the door, wich is very convenient. As a tip from the management and the other staff, we went ( equipped with umbrella, received from the concierge ) to covent garden the same evening, and although it was raining, we had a perfect evening and returned to the hotel tired but in a very good mood. We are both very picky when it comes to beds and not many hotels get away with a good score, but this one sure did, we slept like a baby and woke up much later then usual. After a quick shower, we went down for breakfast in the brasserie. The breakfast was good, not exeptional ( great coffee though ), but it almost never is when it comes to continental breakfast in an english hotel and that's the only remark I can make as where the hotel can improve, if they've had more choice, it would have been a perfect 10 hotel. I won't bore you with the rest of our personal stories in London, but I will stick to everything important : Hotel location : is perfect, almost in Victoria station, we found it easy to walk to Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, St.Pauls etc. but I can imagine if you rather take the tube. The hotel itself : is just the way we like it, an old historic building wonderfully restored, nice features, well, go and see for yourself. The service: is really outstanding, everybody, from the Management, concierges, reception, employees in the brasserie, champagne bar etc. etc. is amazing, I think they would do practically anything for you.
reviews.title: Wonderful Weekend in an Outstanding Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sleeping quality : I read some earlier comment about the hotel being a little noisy, but I can't say I / Or we for that matter share that opinion, not saying it could not be true, because we had a room at the front side of the hotel, which is on the other side of Victoria Station, but as also mentioned earlier, the horel staff will be more then willing to assist, and you can always ask for a front side room when booking. Hygienë : Bathroom was very clean, the room itself as well, but due to allthe fabric used ( Curtains, Flooring, Couch, Bed etc. ) it will attract dust earlier. Glasses, Minibar ( Fridge ), towels etc, very clean as well. I / We, would highly reccomend this hotel to anybody. We had a wonderful weekend celebrating our anniversary and we want to thank Mr. Michael Parker and his entire staff for the warm welcome we received. Next time we will visit London, we will be sure to contact you again. Thanks again!
reviews.title: Fab hotel

reviews.text: Just spent the weekend in London, staying at the Grosvenor. What a lovely hotel. We got a great deal for our room and we were really pleased. Our room was on the top floor, which entailed using two lifts but this was not a problem. Our room was very nice and was exceptionally clean as was everywhere else in the hotel, , and the bed was really comfy. We had the window open and even with construction work going on everywhere there was not much noise. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The refurbishment of the hotel is fab. I would definitely stay again, and would recommend it to others.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Grosvenor is situated right by Victoria station so, if like us you are travelling from the south of England it is perfectly located. There is even an entrance in the station concourse. Otherwise it is well located for a short walk to Buckingham Palace, St James Park, Hyde Park or Westminster. It was my 50th Birthday weekend and we were offered an upgrade to an Executive room on the 6th floor. Not a huge room but well equipped and quiet. The lighting was a little dark but comfortable. We paid a visit to the Champagne Bar before leaving for dinner - very pleasant. Breakfast was generally of good quality although the service was a little chaotic. We were shown to a table that somebody else was already using. We had to ask twice for coffee and twice for toast before getting any. The hot food was in short supply with a queue of people waiting for the trays to be refilled. Hot food was tasty though. Pastries were somewhat dry and there was a surprising dose of chilli in the nuts that were next to the cereals and fruit. In summary - a beautiful building in a lovely location. Staff excellent but breakfast needs some attention.
reviews.title: Can recommend this hotel

I ask you! Booking a table in a bar?? So, sadly, I never got to sample the wonderful bar and exhausted my elderly mother into the bargain.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is fantastically sited for the bus in from Heathrow as it is just around the corner from Victoria Station. When we visited the hotel was getting a revamp and the outside was covered in scaffolding. The lobby is wonderful - very impressive old victorian with a massive staircase made of marble. The check in staff were incredible and offered us an upgrade to a suite for a small charge which also included the breakfast. Of course we agreed! There are 2 suites on the 7th floor and you get the normal lift that goes up to the 6th floor and then take your private lift to your suite! The decor was brilliant, black, gray and red. A very large living area with flat screen telly, sofa bar etc. The bathroom was one of the best I have ever been in. Very large with 2 sinks, a claw footed bath in the middle of the room, a separate toilet and a walk in shower.The bedroom, although not large, had ipod docking stations etc and was again very well decorated. We had 2 doors into the suite and on our second night we found vouchers for 2 free drinks in the cocktail bar of the hotel pushed under one of the doors. We used them the following everning and were very impressed with the decor of the new cocktail lounge. The breakfast room was lovely but we were slightly disappointed with the lay out of the breakfast items. Everything is laid out around the outside of a small room and, although the flood was good, it took ages to get what you wanted because there was just not enough space for the amount of people getting breakfast. This, however, is a really small niggle - I really enjoyed this hotel and would definately go back.
reviews.title: Fantastic Upgrade

reviews.text: Our room was in one of the cupolas on the very top floor, and had no view whatsoever. However it was clean and a decent size.
